entry.title: Re: TDS provisioning
entry.content:
Hello @Rishav4 

Your detailed scenario is correct for e2e TDS provision handling in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud focusing on India localisation.

Looking at the first issue in step 4 about 6001 instead of 6000, this is a rounding difference. The reason is

  • in Public Cloud, withholding tax calculation is always aligned with invoice-base WHT determination and your system currency setting.
  • Decimals are rounded differently, especially when tax base or percentages are calculated across multiple line items during provision creation and further utilisation. That explains why the system rounded the extra ‚Çπ1.

The second issue you mentioned about the error you experience in Remittance Challan usually occurs for some reasons.

  1. Your provision document is already utilised and reserved but the corresponding tax payable balance is not available in the WHT account.
  2. There is a mismatch in the challan grouping due to the extra rounding.
  3. The challan app requires the correct balance in the WHT payable account to match the provisioned amounts.

I recommend you check:

First, in the App ‚ÄúDisplay Line Items in General Ledger‚Äù to ensure that the WHT payable account has the correct balance (6000 vs. 6001)

Then, in the Manage Journal Entries Fiori app, trace the provision and check if the extra rounding line is sitting unallocated.

Finally, if you find a mismatch, run the Utilize Provisions-India‚Äù again or post a small manual adjustment journal entry to align the balances before you generate the challan.

If the mismatch persists, consider opening an SAP incident under component FI-LOC-FI-IN

I hope this provides the desired insight. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: How to trigger Revenue Recognition in S/4HANA Public...
entry.content:
A Preliminary Billing Document is nothing but Proforma in SD and it does not post to FI/CO. Also, it is not considered a revenue‚Äërecognition event in the standard integration content. Therefore, it will not generate RAIs in the Revenue Accounting engine.

Instead of a pro forma, issue an interim actual billing document (posting to FI) at the milestone where you want recognition. Configure your pricing so that this interim bill has zero net effect on customer receivables if needed (e.g., offsetting lines), but still posts revenue for EBRR to pick up. This will create RAIs and trigger recognition.

For some reasons, if the business requirement is ‚Äúrecognise revenue at preliminary bill stage‚Äù and you must stay in Public Cloud standard, then, re‚Äëdesign the process so that the preliminary bill is replaced by an actual milestone bill that posts to FI (even if it‚Äôs later netted off). Or, if you‚Äôre in a professional services scenario, leverage event‚Äëbased recognition from project events instead of from the billing doc.

entry.title: Re: How to trigger Revenue Recognition in S/4HANA Public...
entry.content:
Hello @LDB 

There is a clash between your requirement and what is possible in the Public Cloud. Please note the following:

  • Revenue Accounting Items are only created from final billing documents that are marked as revenue relevant. Which means, preliminary Billing Document (Proforma invoices) are not revenue relevant and therefore cannot trigger RAIs or revenue recognition postings.
  • The restriction is standard in Public Cloud because RAI are generated only at the stage of final customer invoice. Preliminary billing documents are only for simulation and review purposes.

However, there are options you can consider in Public Cloud. These include:

  1. The usage of Contract-based Revenue Recognition. You can configure for example service contract with periodic revenue recognition. Doing that will ensure your revenue recognition can occur independently of billing and based on your contract‚Äôs fulfilment rules.
  2. Another is the Down Payments/Partial invoices (Milestones Billing). This comes in play if your business process requires revenue to be recognise progressively. You can use it to carry out periodic billing with final invoices for each milestone. Each final billing document will then create RAIs.
  3. Finally, if your business requires simulation-level RAIs at the primary stage, consider Custom Extension using BTP (side-by-side extension). This enables you capture preliminary billing events and provides a reporting layer. Please note that this is a workaround and not a standard Revenue Account.

Consult the following references for details

Revenue Accounting Overview

SAP Billing and Revenue Innovation Management Localization: Innovations in 2502

Event Based Revenue Recognition - Provider Contract (Subscription Billing) - (5DQ)

Billing and Revenue Integration in SAP S/4HANA Cloud

I hope this provides the desired insight. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: After executing the data action, the manually entered parameter values remain cached for the session
entry.content:
Hi,

We‚Äôre working with a scenario where a data action prompt is prefilled based on table selection. The input controls are dynamically assigned via script according to the selected table row. This setup works well‚Äîas long as the user doesn‚Äôt manually change the prompt values.

However, once a user manually modifies the parameter values in the data action prompt (f.e. different cost center) and executes the action, those manually entered values persist for the session. After that, the prompt no longer reflects updates from the input controls, even though the script continues assigning the correct values.

While resetting the story via Edit > Reset resolves the issue, it‚Äôs not a viable option due to long loading times.

Could you please confirm if this is a known behavior? And is there any recommended workaround‚Äîideally one that doesn‚Äôt require rebuilding the prompt dialog from scratch?

Many thanks,
Fabian

entry.title: Date Constraints in SAP Project and Resource Management
entry.content:
Meet Deadlines - Date Constraints in SAP Project and Resource Management 
SAP Project and Resource Management (SAP PRM) now allows you to define date constraints to ensure that critical project plan elements (work packages or milestones) start and finish on time. This reduces the likelihood of delays, facilitates the anticipation of bottlenecks, and enhances project scheduling capabilities. 
You can set 'Must Start On' and 'Must Finish On' constraints using the 'Manage Project Plans' app. In the Gantt Chart, constraints are displayed as small red triangles positioned on the top for Start Constraints and on the bottom for Finish Constraints. Milestones are limited to a Planned Finish date, which means they include the finish constraint but do not have a start constraint. 
When constraints are set and scheduling is initiated, any resulting conflicts‚Äîsuch as overlapping project plan elements‚Äîare shown as messages for the affected project plan elements, supporting easier access and quicker resolution.  
There are various methods to set or remove constraints, each tailored to specific purposes: 
 
There are various methods to set or remove constraints, each tailored to specific purposes: 
1. Detail Page 
2. Action Button 
3. Gantt Chart 
4. Table View 
5. Project Plan Service API 
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

1. Detail Page ‚Äì Specify Constraints and include a corresponding Note (Reason) while maintaining a comprehensive overview of the selected project plan element:
 

2. Action Button - for setting or removing constraints on multiple project elements: 
Select the project elements you want to modify, then click the 'Action' Button to either add or remove constraints. If you opt for ‚ÄòSet Date Constraints‚Äô on a work package, you'll automatically set the Planned Start and Planned Finish as 'Must Start On' and 'Must Finish On' constraints. For milestones, only the Planned Finish date will be set as the 'Must Finish On' constraint. 

3. Right-Click Menu on Gantt Chart ‚Äì Provides enhanced individual control and quick access for adjustments within the Gantt view: 
Right-click on the relevant bar and select 'Set Date Constraints' or 'Remove Date Constraints' to choose whether to apply or remove the 'Must Start On' or 'Must Finish On' constraint. 
 

4. Table view ‚Äì quick date entry by tabbing through constraint fields: 
Utilize the table settings to reveal the columns: ‚ÄòStart Date Constraint‚Äô and ‚ÄòFinish Date Constraint‚Äô. Switching to the ‚ÄòDisplay Table‚Äô view provides a clearer overview of the project plan in table format. 

5. Project Plan Service API - to modify constraint settings:  
For detailed information, refer to the Business Accelerator Hub.

entry.title: Compilation of ABAP SQL window functions from the ABAP Keyword Documentation
entry.content:
If like me you don't know well the ABAP SQL window functions (partitions with OVER, window functions) and have difficulties to quickly choose between them, here's a compilation of the ABAP Keyword Documentation + ABAP results. It concerns ABAP 7.58.

  • AVG (ask me if you need it)
  • CORR (ask)
  • CORR_SPEARMAN (ask)
  • COUNT
  • DENSE_RANK
  • FIRST_VALUE
  • LAG
  • LAST_VALUE
  • LEAD
  • MAX
  • MEDIAN (ask)
  • MIN
  • NTILE
  • RANK
  • ROW_NUMBER
  • STDDEV (ask)
  • VAR (ask)

FIRST_VALUE, LAST_VALUE

Content of table DEMO_UPDATE:

IDCOL1COL2COL3
A1562
B1462
C1862
D11062
E197862
F192788
G1099
H10124
I2100144
J24344
K2444
L21744
M23344
N210044
O210144
P2583955
Q254877
R218133
S355434623
T31001111

ABAP SQL:

SELECT 
      id, 
      col1, 
      col2, 
      col3, 
      FIRST_VALUE( col2 ) OVER( PARTITION BY col1 ORDER BY col3 ) 
                  AS first_value, 
      LAST_VALUE( col2 ) OVER( PARTITION BY col1 ORDER BY col3 ) 
                  AS last_value, 
      LAST_VALUE( col2 ) OVER( PARTITION BY col1 ORDER BY col3 
                  ROWS BETWEEN UNBOUNDED PRECEDING 
                  AND UNBOUNDED FOLLOWING ) 
                  AS last_value_correct 
      FROM demo_update 
      INTO TABLE @FINAL(result).

Result and explanations (copied from ABAP Keyword Documentation):

 

The class CL_DEMO_SELECT_FIRST_LAST divides the rows from the DEMO_UPDATE table into three partitions (orange, red, purple), depending on their value in COL1. Within the partitions, the rows are ordered by their value in COL3.

The column FIRST_VALUE returns the first value of COL2 for each partition.

The column LAST_VALUE does not return the last value. With the LAST_VALUE function, framing is an important aspect to consider. The default frame is ROWS BETWEEN UNBOUNDED PRECEDING AND CURRENT ROW, so the LAST_VALUE function always returns the value from the current row. To find the last value for a partition or a window, the correct frame has to be specified explicitly: ROWS BETWEEN UNBOUNDED PRECEDING AND UNBOUNDED FOLLOWING as shown in LAST_VALUE_CORRECT. If COL3 contains duplicate values, the rows are considered equal and the last value from the group of equals is returned.

In this example, COL3 has multiple duplicate values. The key field - here the field ID - is used to sort rows with the same value.

LAG, LEAD

Content of table DEMO_EXPRESSIONS:

IDCHAR1CHAR2NUM1

ABAP SQL:

    SELECT char1, char2, 
           num1, 
           ROW_NUMBER( ) 
             OVER( PARTITION BY char1 ORDER BY char2 ) 
               AS rnum, 
           LEAD( CAST( num1 AS CHAR( 11 ) ), 1, 'Nope' ) 
             OVER( PARTITION BY char1 ORDER BY char2 ) 
               AS lead1, 
           LAG( CAST( num1 AS CHAR( 11 ) ), 1, 'Nope' ) 
             OVER( PARTITION BY char1 ORDER BY char2 ) 
               AS lag1, 
           LEAD( CAST( num1 AS CHAR( 11 ) ), 2, 'Nope' ) 
             OVER( PARTITION BY char1 ORDER BY char2 ) 
               AS lead2, 
           LAG( CAST( num1 AS CHAR( 11 ) ), 2, 'Nope' ) 
             OVER( PARTITION BY char1 ORDER BY char2 ) 
               AS lag2, 
           LEAD( CAST( num1 AS CHAR( 11 ) ), 10, 'Nope' ) 
             OVER( PARTITION BY char1 ORDER BY char2 ) 
               AS lead10, 
           LAG( CAST( num1 AS CHAR( 11 ) ), 10, 'Nope' ) 
             OVER( PARTITION BY char1 ORDER BY char2 ) 
               AS lag10 
           FROM demo_expressions 
           ORDER BY char1, char2                        "#EC CI_NOWHERE 
           INTO TABLE @FINAL(windowed_order_ascending) ##no_text.

               AS lag1,

               AS lead10,

             OVER( PARTITION BY char1 ORDER BY char2 DESCENDING ) 
               AS lag10 
           FROM demo_expressions 
           ORDER BY char1, char2                        "#EC CI_NOWHERE

entry.title: error with webservice Procedure in SQL Anywhere
entry.content:
I have a problem while calling an externail API from inside Procedure in SQL-Anywhere database.

The exact error code is:

Could not execute statement.
The secure connection to the remote host failed: The connection was
closed from the other side
SQLCODE=-990, ODBC 3 State="HY000"
Line 1, column 1)

My Code looks like this:

create or replace procedure myprocget()
url 'https://mydomain/api/'
type 'http:get'
header 'Authorization: Bearer ****'
set 'HTTP(VERSION=1.1)';
call myprocget()-- OK

create or replace procedure myprocpost(mybody long varchar)
url 'https://mydomain/api/'
type 'http:post:application/json'
header 'Content-Type: application/json\nAuthorization: Bearer ****'
set 'HTTP(VERSION=1.1)';
call myprocpost('{"customer_code": 1}')--I get the above error

Despite the above error, everything works on the webserver, and the post (with {"customer_code": 1} is done on the webserver) but I see only the error in my database.

I have looked in the Forum for a similar error, I find only those related to certificate, which is not the problem in my case since the GET method to the same URL and endpoint works fine.

The only thing is that the POST Method on this endpoint delivers HTTP 402 (No Content)!
I dont even think that this could be the problem, since calling the endpoint with Curl also works:

curl "https://mydomain/api/" --header "Content-Type: application/json" --header "Authorization: Bearer ****" --data "{\"customer_code\": 1}"


Does someone have any idea?

entry.title: Re: There is already a handling unit * posted for GR with...
entry.content:
In your case, the HU number already exists in ECC from 2015, so when decentralized EWM tries to post the goods issue back to ERP, the inbound qRFC fails because ERP sees that HU as already ‚Äúconsumed‚Äù in a historical delivery. That‚Äôs why EWM shows the delivery as completed (because the warehouse task/HU processing finished locally). The outbound queue to ERP is stuck, so ERP‚Äôs goods movement status never flips to ‚ÄúCompleted‚Äù.

  • To fix this, go to SMQ1 in EWM, filter by your delivery number or LUW containing /SCWM/‚Ä¶ function modules (e.g. /SCWM/ERP_GOODSMVT_OUTBOUND). Display the error text. You should see something like ‚ÄúHU already exists‚Äù or ‚ÄúHU already assigned to delivery ‚Ä¶‚Äù.
  • Go to HUMO in ECC, Enter the HU number and check the Status, Assigned document (old delivery from 2015). This confirms the HU number conflict.

So with the above scenario, you have two options.

Option A ‚Äì Change HU number in EWM
Unpack the item from the problematic HU in EWM.  Create a new HU with a fresh number range (one that does not exist in ERP). Repack the goods and re‚Äëpost the goods issue.  This avoids the conflict entirely.

Option B ‚Äì Clean up HU in ERP
If the old HU is no longer relevant and can be archived/closed, you could technically delete or renumber it in ERP ‚Äî but in practice, HU numbers are not meant to be reused, so this is rarely recommended in production.

SAP best practice is to ensure separate HU number ranges for EWM and ERP to avoid reuse.

Once the HU conflict is resolved:

Go back to SMQ1 in EWM, select the stuck LUW and choose Execute LUW (or Activate if it‚Äôs in SMQ2 inbound in ERP). The goods movement should post in ERP, and the delivery status will update.

entry.title: How to Migrate data in SAP Intelligent Clinical Supply Management (ICSM)
entry.content:
SAP Intelligent Clinical Supply Management (ICSM) is an advanced, hybrid solution supporting clinical supply chain operations, which is built on SAP S/4HANA and SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP).

Enables planning of manufacturing, distribution, and monitoring of clinical trial materials.

Clinical data is being maintained in legacy systems such as spreadsheets or custom-built databases, Hence, migrating from legacy systems to ICSM enables harmonization and helps in automating trial supply management

 

Key Steps in SAP ICSM Data Migration:

           Data and Field Mapping Workshops

  • Identify all relevant data objects
  1. study master data
  2. sites, inventory
  3. Material batches
  4. shipment data and so on ...
  • Design ‚Äúsource to target‚Äù mapping: relate each field from the old system to its equivalent in SAP ICSM.
  • Validate and cleanse data by harmonizing from source and ensure the deduplication is taken care

    Data Migration Tools and Approach
  • Use any ETL tool to perform Extraction from source (could also be flat file) and Transform as per the Target structure to convert the unstructured clinical data to desired SAP ICSM standards
  • Leverage SAP-provided API (CTMS - Study Data) for the Batch migration facilitating streamlined data transfer into SAP ICSM

    Testing & Simulation (Realization)
  • Perform trial runs and simulate data loads using API into the desired environment.
  • Conduct functional, integration, and regression testing to ensure migrated data performs as required.
  • Ensure the Migrated ICSM Data is properly integrated within the Material master Study tab

    Challenges
  • Migrating extensive Clinical data such as Study and Hierarchical data in large volumes is time consuming and missing the End-to-End integration
  • To Mitigate:
    • Always use the SAP provided APIs to handle the large datasets and reliable and proper integration across modules
    • Automate the migration process where possible; avoid manual entry

Finally Addressing these challenges with proactive planning and cross-functional collaboration is key to a successful and compliant SAP ICSM data migration

Stay tuned for the further release, Next blog covers following content : 

1. Detailed migration process on the List of objects available in the ICSM 

2. Step by step procedure on calling the API for loading the data from source to ICSM

3. Different techniques of API call 

SAP Intelligent Clinical Supply Management

entry.title: Re: The Unofficial SAP Community HTML Tags Documentation
entry.content:
An hyperlink may go to inside the blog post (e.g., a table of contents) if the target is a heading. When saving, an ID is allocated to a title (e.g., <h2 id="toc-hId-1366081506">SAP Community Custom Tags</h2>). You may then create an hyperlink to this heading by using #toc-hId-1366081506. Example: link to SAP Community Custom Tags.

Create these hyperlinks only late or when you are sure that the headings are frozen (no heading deletion or insertion), because the previous IDs are reassigned to the headings in the sequence top-to-bottom, i.e., if you insert or delete headings, the IDs will become wrong after the positions where they are changed.

Note that I couldn't define a custom tag manually (e.g., <h1><a name="tag">Heading</a></h1>).

entry.title: How to Configure SSO for SAP GUI Including MFA
entry.content:
Security threats are growing more sophisticated and credentials are often the weakest link, so relying on passwords alone is no longer enough. Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) adds an extra layer of protection by requiring a second factor‚Äîsuch as a mobile app prompt, hardware token, or biometric verification‚Äîbefore granting access. By enforcing MFA for SAP GUI, you safeguard sensitive business data against unauthorized access, even if user credentials are compromised.

Why You Can‚Äôt Use Common Web Authentication Methods for SAP GUI

You may already know web-based Single Sign-On (SSO) standards like SAML 2.0 or OpenID Connect (OIDC). (If not, I recommend checking out this comparison post for background.) However, these standards cannot be used directly with SAP GUI. The reason is that SAP GUI for Windows and SAP GUI for Java communicate with the SAP NetWeaver Application Server ABAP using the RFC protocol, which is not HTTP-based. As a result, SAML and OIDC are not supported in this context.

To enable SSO in SAP GUI, a different method is required‚Äînamely, Secure Network Communications (SNC) combined with SAP‚Äôs Secure Login infrastructure. SAP‚Äôs recommended setup uses the Secure Login Client (SLC) together with Secure Login Service (SLS). This solution issues short-lived X.509 certificates based on identities authenticated via SAP Cloud Identity (SCI). The advantage of this approach is that it lets organizations reuse the same MFA methods already in place for web applications, delivering a consistent and secure user experience across both browser and SAP GUI access.

Prerequisites for the Configuration

Before diving into the MFA setup, you‚Äôll want to make sure that the basics are covered. This includes having administrative access to all key components in your landscape: your corporate Identity Provider tenant (such as Microsoft Entra ID), your SAP Cloud Identity (SCI) tenant, and the SAP BTP subaccount that trusts the IAS tenant. You will also need the appropriate licenses or entitlements for Secure Login Service (SLS) in the BTP subaccount.

On the client side, make sure your environment is up to date. You should have SAP GUI 7.70 or later installed on your machine, along with the SAP Secure Login Client (SLC) version 3.0 SP02 Patch Level 16 or newer. These versions are required for compatibility with the SSO and MFA setup.

Additional Steps

In addition to the prerequisites above, a few more preparatory steps are needed to ensure secure communication and trust between systems.

Start by downloading the SAP Cloud Root CA certificate from https://www.pki.co.sap.com. This certificate must be imported both into the target machine and into the SAP system itself using the STRUST transaction. For quick proof-of-concept projects, this can be done manually. However, in production environments, you should distribute the certificate via a Mobile Device Management (MDM) solution to keep things consistent and scalable.

Next, you‚Äôll need to configure Secure Network Communications (SNC) in the SAP AS ABAP system. For testing purposes, you can use the SNCWIZARD to simplify setup. That said, in production scenarios it‚Äôs better to avoid SNCWIZARD, as it tends to configure more than is strictly necessary. Instead, activate the required SNC parameters manually, and consult the relevant  SAP Note on SNC activation for detailed guidance: https://me.sap.com/notes/2440692

With SNC configured on the backend, don‚Äôt forget to adjust SAP GUI itself to use SNC. Without this, the secure channel won‚Äôt actually be leveraged during client connections.

Finally, establish the trust relationships between your identity services. First, register the IAS tenant in Entra ID and then configure the Corporate Identity Provider within the IAS tenant. Similarly, register the SCI tenant in Entra ID by following Microsoft‚Äôs official guide. For advanced MFA scenarios, configure the Corporate Identity Provider in the SCI tenant as described in the same guide.

These steps ensure that your certificates, secure channels, and identity federation are in place‚Äîsetting the stage for a smooth rollout of SSO with MFA in SAP GUI.

Step-by-Step Configuration

Step 1: Configure Authentication for SLS and Retrieve Host Policy Group URL

  • Assign the proper roles, such as SecureLoginServiceAdministrator, to your SLS admins. This must be done using the trusting SCI tenant, since the service users cannot be managed directly in the BTP user store.
  • With the roles assigned, log into the SLS Web UI. From here you can:
    • Manage the validity period of user certificates
    • Retrieve the Host Policy Group URL needed for Secure Login Client configuration

Step 2: Adapt Subject Name Identifier in IAS for the SLS Application

  • Ensure attribute values in user master data match the corporate IdP configuration.
  • For testing, you can use simple attributes like login name or email against the SCI tenant.
  • Important: disable the conditional authentication option during testing to avoid being redirected back to your corporate IdP.

Step 3: Configure Secure Login Client Preferences

  • Use the Host Policy Group URL from Step 1 to configure Secure Login Client (SLC) preferences.
  • For enterprise-wide rollout, use your Mobile Device Management (MDM) platform according to the target OS. Reference documentation: SAP Secure Login Service Help.

Step 4: Map SNC User Names in AS ABAP

  • Configure SNC-specific user names in the SAP system using transaction SU01.
  • For multiple users, use transaction SNC1, or better yet, leverage your enterprise-wide identity management system to distribute SNC names automatically to user master data.

Step 5: Test Login and Configure MFA

  • First test if SSO works without MFA. This ensures your baseline configuration is correct.
  • Then enable MFA in Entra ID using your preferred method (e.g., Microsoft Authenticator, FIDO2, SMS OTP).
  • Test again with MFA enabled to confirm end-to-end functionality.

With these steps completed, you‚Äôll have successfully configured SSO for SAP GUI with MFA enabled‚Äîcombining user convenience with strong enterprise-grade security.

Further Resources

entry.title: Re: SAP Business Data Cloud Series ‚Äì Part 1: Introduction to Data Products
entry.content:
Hi @jeetendrakapase  and thank you for the insightful post. 

I cannot quite understand what is the benefit of using data products for analytics and reporting.

In reporting scenarios where speed is a key factor, we anyways need to replicate the data in Datasphere and have it In-memory. For this we can just acquire data via replication flows from CDS views on S4 side. Yes, the data products add semantics to the raw tables, but in Datasphere there is already semantic onboarding and the described result seems to be quite similar. 

For scenarios where speed is not a big factor, we can still access S4 CDS views as remote tables.

In both cases, the additional storage in FOS seems redundant, so perhaps I am missing something.

Could you, please, elaborate on this?

entry.title: Clarification on CVE-2025-42951 ‚Äì Which Support Package Patches Are Safe?
entry.content:
Hello Community,

I‚Äôm reviewing SAP Security Note 3625403 regarding CVE-2025-42951 (Broken Authorization in SAP Business One SLD).

In the note it says: ‚ÄúPlease implement the Support Packages and Patches referenced in this SAP security Note.‚Äù
When I click on the Support Package Patches link inside the note, it redirects me to the SAP Download Center where I see a full list of installation packages (Feature Packages, Support Packages, etc.) for SAP Business One 10.0.

My question is:

  • Are all versions listed on that download page considered safe, or

  • Is the vulnerability fixed only in Support Package Patches released after 12 August 2025 (the publication date of the note)?

I want to be sure whether older Feature Packages shown in that list (e.g. FP 2011, FP 2208, etc.) are actually patched, or if only the newer ones (2502 and later) include the fix.

Has anyone clarified this with SAP or tested which Support Package levels are secured?

Thanks in advance for your input!

  • ÊúÄÂÑ™ÂÖà„ÅßAMERÂú∞Âüü„ÅÆÂ£≤‰∏äÊ∏õÂ∞ëË¶ÅÂõ†„ÇíÁ≤æÊüª„Åô„Åπ„Åç„Åß„Åô„ÄÇÁâπ„Å´5Êúà„Å´ÊÄ•Â¢ó„Åó„ÅüRC-1057„ÄÅCC-1022„ÄÅCC-1023„ÅÆÂèóÊ≥®Áä∂Ê≥Å„ÄÅÁ¥çÊúü„ÉªÂú®Â∫´ÁÆ°ÁêÜ„ÄÅÈ°ßÂÆ¢Â•ëÁ¥ÑÊõ¥Êñ∞Áä∂Ê≥Å„ÇíÁ¢∫Ë™ç„Åó„Å¶„Åè„Å†„Åï„ÅÑ„ÄÇ
  • EMEA„Å´„Å§„ÅÑ„Å¶„ÇÇÂêåÊßò„Å´„ÄÅ5Êúà„ÅÆ„Éî„Éº„ÇØ„Åå6Êúà„Å´ÊåÅÁ∂ö„Åó„Å™„Åã„Å£„ÅüÁêÜÁî±Ôºà„Ç≠„É£„É≥„Éö„Éº„É≥ÁµÇ‰∫Ü„ÄÅ‰∏ªË¶ÅÈ°ßÂÆ¢„ÅÆÂ≠£ÁØÄÁöÑÈúÄË¶ÅÊ∏õÔºâ„ÇíÊääÊè°„Åó„ÄÅÊ¨°Êúü„ÅÆË≤©Â£≤Ë®àÁîª„Å´ÂèçÊò†„Åï„Åõ„ÇãÂøÖË¶Å„Åå„ÅÇ„Çä„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ
  • APJ„ÅÆ‰∫àÊ∏¨„ÅåÂèñÂæó„Åß„Åç„Å¶„ÅÑ„Å™„ÅÑÁÇπ„ÅØ„ÄÅ„Éá„Éº„ÇøÂèñÂæó„Éó„É≠„Çª„Çπ„ÅÆÂÜçÁ¢∫Ë™ç„Å®„ÄÅÂøÖË¶Å„Å™„Çâ„Å∞Âà•ÈÄî‰∫àÊ∏¨„É¢„Éá„É´„ÇíËµ∞„Çâ„Åõ„Çã„Åì„Å®„ÇíÊé®Â•®„Åó„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ

    „Åì„Å°„Çâ„ÇÇÂÖ∑‰ΩìÁöÑ„Å™ÂÜÖÂÆπ„Å´„Å™„Å£„Å¶„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ


„Åæ„Åü„ÄÅËøΩÂä†„ÅÆË≥™Âïè„Å®„Åó„Å¶„ÄÅÂàÜÊûêÁµêÊûú„Å´„Å§„ÅÑ„Å¶„Äå‰ªäÂõûÂàÜÊûê„Å´ÁâπÂæ¥Èáè„ÉªÊ©üÊ¢∞Â≠¶Áøí„ÇíÂà©Áî®„Åó„Å¶„ÅÑ„ÇãË™çË≠ò„Åß„Åô„Åå„ÄÅ„Åù„Çå„Åå„Å©„ÅÆ„Çà„ÅÜ„Å™ÂÜÖÂÆπ„Åã„Å®„ÄÅ‰ªäÂõû„ÅÆÂàÜÊûê„Å´„Å©„ÅÆ„Çà„ÅÜ„Å´‰Ωø„Çè„Çå„Å¶„ÅÑ„Çã„Åã„ÇíË™¨Êòé„Åó„Å¶„Åè„Å†„Åï„ÅÑ„ÄÇ„Äç„Å®Ë≥™Âïè„Åó„Åü„Å®„Åì„Çç„ÄÅ‰ª•‰∏ã„ÅÆ„Çà„ÅÜ„Å™ÂõûÁ≠î„ÅåËøî„Å£„Å¶„Åç„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÄÇ

  • ÁâπÂæ¥Èáè„ÅØ„ÄåÂπ¥Êúà„Äç„ÄåÂú∞Âüü„Äç„ÄåË£ΩÂìÅ„Äç„ÄåÈÅéÂéªÊï∞„ÅãÊúà„ÅÆÂ£≤‰∏ä„Äç„ÄåÂ≠£ÁØÄÊåáÊ®ô„Äç„ÄåÂ§ñÈÉ®„Ç§„Éô„É≥„Éà„Éï„É©„Ç∞„Äç„Å™„Å©„ÄÅÊôÇÁ≥ªÂàó„Å®„Ç´„ÉÜ„Ç¥„É™ÊÉÖÂ†±„ÇíÁµÑ„ÅøÂêà„Çè„Åõ„Åü„ÇÇ„ÅÆ„Åß„Åô„ÄÇ
  • „É¢„Éá„É´„ÅØÂ≠£ÁØÄÊÄß„Éª„Éà„É¨„É≥„Éâ„ÇíÊçâ„Åà„ÇãÁµ±Ë®àÁöÑÊâãÊ≥ï„Å®„ÄÅÊÆãÂ∑Æ„Çí‰∫àÊ∏¨„Åô„ÇãÂãæÈÖç„Éñ„Éº„Çπ„ÉÜ„Ç£„É≥„Ç∞Êú®ÔºàXGBoost Á≠âÔºâ„Çí„Éè„Ç§„Éñ„É™„ÉÉ„Éâ„Å´„Åó„Åü„ÇÇ„ÅÆ„Åß„Åô„ÄÇ
  • ‰ªäÂõû„ÅØ7Êúà„ÅÆÂ£≤‰∏ä‰∫àÊ∏¨„Å´„Å†„ÅëÊ©üÊ¢∞Â≠¶Áøí„ÅåÂà©Áî®„Åï„Çå„ÄÅÂÆüÁ∏æ„Éá„Éº„Çø„Å®„ÅÆ‰πñÈõ¢„Åã„Çâ„ÄÅ‰∫àÊ∏¨ÂØæË±°„ÅÆË£ΩÂìÅÊäú„Åë„ÇÑÂ≠£ÁØÄÊÄß„ÅÆÈÅéÂ∫¶„Å™‰ΩéÊ∏õ„ÅåÂïèÈ°å„Åß„ÅÇ„Çã„Å®Âà§Êòé„Åó„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÄÇ

AI„ÅØ„Åï„Çâ„Å´„ÄÅ‰∫àÊ∏¨Á≤æÂ∫¶„Çí‰∏ä„Åí„Çã„Åü„ÇÅ„ÅÆÁ§∫ÂîÜ„Å®„Åó„Å¶„ÄÅAPI„Éï„Ç£„É´„Çø„Éº„ÅÆË¶ãÁõ¥„Åó„ÄÅÂ§ñÈÉ®„Ç§„Éô„É≥„ÉàÊÉÖÂ†±„ÅÆÁµÑ„ÅøËæº„Åø„ÄÅ„É©„Ç∞„ÇÑÁßªÂãïÂπ≥Âùá„ÅÆË®≠ÂÆö„ÄÅÂ≠¶ÁøíÊúüÈñì„ÅÆÊã°Âºµ„Å™„Å©„ÇíÊèêÊ°à„Åó„Å¶„Åè„Çå„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÄÇ„ÇÇ„Å°„Çç„Çì„ÄÅ„Åì„ÅÆÂàÜÊûê„ÅåÊ≠£„Åó„ÅÑ„Åã„ÅØÁèæÊôÇÁÇπ„Åß„ÅØÁü•„ÇãÁî±„ÇÇ„ÅÇ„Çä„Åæ„Åõ„Çì„Åå„ÄÅ„Åæ„Çã„Åß„Éá„Éº„ÇøÂàÜÊûê„ÅÆÂ∞ÇÈñÄÂÆ∂„Åå‰º¥Ëµ∞„Åó„Å¶„Åè„Çå„Å¶„ÅÑ„Çã„Çà„ÅÜ„Åß„ÅÇ„Çä„ÄÅÂ∞ÇÈñÄÂÆ∂Ôºà„Éá„Éº„Çø„Çµ„Ç§„Ç®„É≥„ÉÜ„Ç£„Çπ„ÉàÔºâ„Åß„Å™„Åè„Å¶„ÇÇ„ÄÅÁ≤æÂ∫¶„Çí‰∏ä„Åí„Å¶„ÅÑ„Åè„Åì„Å®„Åå„Åß„Åç„ÇãÂèØËÉΩÊÄß„ÇíÊÑü„Åò„Çâ„Çå„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÄÇ

„Åì„ÅÆ„Éè„É≥„Ç∫„Ç™„É≥„ÇíÈÄö„Åó„Å¶„ÄÅ„Éì„Ç∏„Éç„Çπ„Éá„Éº„Çø„Å´ÂØæ„Åó„Å¶AI„ÇíÂÆüÈöõ„Å´Ê¥ªÁî®„Åó„ÄÅÂàÜÊûê„É¨„Éù„Éº„Éà„ÅÆ‰ΩúÊàê„Åã„Çâ‰∫àÊ∏¨„Å´Âü∫„Å•„ÅÑ„ÅüÁ§∫ÂîÜ„ÅÆÂ∞éÂá∫„Åæ„Åß„ÅÆ‰∏ÄÈÄ£„ÅÆÊµÅ„Çå„Çí„ÄÅDatabricks‰∏ä„Åß‰ΩìÈ®ì„Åô„Çã„Å®„ÅÑ„ÅÜË≤¥Èáç„Å™Â≠¶„Å≥„ÇíÂæó„Çã„Åì„Å®„Åå„Åß„Åç„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÄÇ

ÁöÜ„Åï„Çì„ÅØ„ÄÅËá™Á§æ„ÅÆ„Åô„Åπ„Å¶„ÅÆ„Éá„Éº„Çø„Å®‰ºöË©±„Åß„Åç„Çã„Å®„Åó„Åü„Çâ„ÄÅ„Å©„ÅÆ„Çà„ÅÜ„Å™Ë≥™Âïè„Çí„Åó„Å¶„Åø„Åü„ÅÑ„Åß„Åô„ÅãÔºüü§î

entry.title: Re: SAP Business Data Cloud Series ‚Äì Part 3: Customer-Managed Data Products
entry.content:
@PraveenJelli - Please find answers to Qs:

Disk + Memory Spaces
Is it possible to create a data product from a space that uses disk + memory (instead of memory-only)?

In SAP Datasphere, data products fall into two categories:

Data Marketplace Products ‚Äì Built within Datasphere, these can persist data in disk + memory and be shared across different spaces. However, they are not Delta-Share enabled and cannot be shared with databricks as of today.

BDC (Delta-Share Enabled) Products ‚Äì Persisted in the object store/data lake (HDLF) as Delta Lake tables. Since the Delta-Share protocol requires data to be stored as Delta Lake tables, these products are specifically designed for external sharing and interoperability.

Integration Hours Calculation
How to calculate the integration effort (hours) required to replicate data from S/4 to a space with disk + memory or to the object store?

Please refer the sizing blog: Replication Flow Blog Series Part 4 - Sizing
Incorrect Data Handling
How can we correct invalid dates or field values (e.g., .00.0000 in date fields) when loading data from S/4 to Datasphere?
Since replication flows (RF) cannot handle such corrections directly, what is the best practice for remediation?

Two approaches are recommended:

  1. Source-side handling ‚Äì Perform the conversion or cleanup in the source system (e.g., enhance the CDS view with transformation logic).

  2. Datasphere replication flow + transformation flow ‚Äì Create a replication flow (Extract-Load) with an inbound table to capture replicated data , then build a transformation flow to clean/convert the data before loading it into the final target table (Transform-Load). This approach creates separate staging/materialized layers for better control.

Hope this helps and happy learning - Jeet

entry.title: Excel Upload/ Download Template/ Download Processed Data in SAP Fiori Without SAPUI5 - Using SAP RAP
entry.content:
In many projects, there is a common requirement to develop utilities for mass creation or update of business objects such as Purchase Orders, Materials, Sales Orders, Billing Documents etc. With the adoption of SAP S/4HANA, customers are increasingly opting for SAP Fiori applications over traditional classical reports for such use cases.

A frequent question arises:
Can we develop a Fiori application to upload files without building a custom SAPUI5 front end?
Yes, we can!

Thanks to SAP‚Äôs RESTful Application Programming (RAP) model and the use of specific annotations, it is possible to handle file uploads directly within a Fiori Elements application. No need for custom UI5 development.

To enable file uploads in RAP, the following annotation is crucial:

@Semantics.largeObject

This annotation allows handling of large file content (LOBs) in the RAP model. However, there is one important requirement:
You need to create a dedicated database table to store the uploaded file as a large object.

In below Example, I am explaining how Billing Date can be changed through Mass Upload.

In Excel Template I have two columns
Billing Document and New Billing date (DD.MM.YYYY).
Let‚Äôs walk through the steps to implement this.

Create Database and Draft Tables

We will begin by creating two database tables and their respective draft tables:

  1. Parent Table ‚Äì Stores file metadata and the file content itself (LOB).
  2. Child Table ‚Äì Stores the extracted data from the uploaded file. In this example, we will process a XLSX file.
Parent Table ‚Äì ZTOM_T_USER

This table will store the uploaded file and its metadata. Here‚Äôs a sample structure:

@EndUserText.label : 'User Table for Excel Processing'
@AbapCatalog.enhancement.category : #NOT_EXTENSIBLE
@AbapCatalog.tableCategory : #TRANSPARENT
@AbapCatalog.deliveryClass : #A
@AbapCatalog.dataMaintenance : #ALLOWED
define table ztom_t_user {
  key mandt             : mandt not null;
  key end_user          : syuname not null;
  status                : abap.char(20);
  attachment            : ztom_de_attach;
  mimetype              : abap.char(128);
  filename              : abap.char(128);
  local_created_by      : abp_creation_user;
  local_created_at      : abp_creation_tstmpl;
  local_last_changed_by : abp_locinst_lastchange_user;
  local_last_changed_at : abp_locinst_lastchange_tstmpl;
  last_changed_at       : abp_lastchange_tstmpl;

}

This setup ensures the uploaded file can be stored as a RAWSTRING (LENGTH 0) in the backend.

 

Parent Draft Table ‚Äì ZTOM_T_USERD
@EndUserText.label : 'User Draft Table for Excel Processing'
@AbapCatalog.enhancement.category : #NOT_EXTENSIBLE
@AbapCatalog.tableCategory : #TRANSPARENT
@AbapCatalog.deliveryClass : #A
@AbapCatalog.dataMaintenance : #ALLOWED
define table ztom_t_userd {
  key mandt             : mandt not null;
  key end_user          : syuname not null;
  status                : abap.char(20);
  attachment            : ztom_de_attach;
  mimetype              : abap.char(128);
  filename              : abap.char(128);
  local_created_by      : abp_creation_user;
  local_created_at      : abp_creation_tstmpl;
  local_last_changed_by : abp_locinst_lastchange_user;
  local_last_changed_at : abp_locinst_lastchange_tstmpl;
  last_changed_at       : abp_lastchange_tstmpl;
  "%admin"              : include sych_bdl_draft_admin_inc;

}

 

Child Table ‚Äì ZTOM_T_EXCEL

This table will store the extracted data from the uploaded file. In this example, we will process a XLSX file. Here‚Äôs a sample structure:

@EndUserText.label : 'Excel Data Table'
@AbapCatalog.enhancement.category : #NOT_EXTENSIBLE
@AbapCatalog.tableCategory : #TRANSPARENT
@AbapCatalog.deliveryClass : #A
@AbapCatalog.dataMaintenance : #ALLOWED
define table ztom_t_excel {
  key mandt    : mandt not null;
  @AbapCatalog.foreignKey.screenCheck : false
  key end_user : syuname not null
    with foreign key ztom_t_user
      where end_user = ztom_t_excel.end_user;
  key vbeln    : vbeln_vf not null;
  new_fkdat    : abap.char(10);
  prev_fkdat   : abap.char(10);
  type         : bapi_mtype;
  message      : bapi_msg;

}

 

Child Draft Table ‚Äì ZTOM_T_EXCELD
@EndUserText.label : 'Excel Data Draft Table'
@AbapCatalog.enhancement.category : #NOT_EXTENSIBLE
@AbapCatalog.tableCategory : #TRANSPARENT
@AbapCatalog.deliveryClass : #A
@AbapCatalog.dataMaintenance : #ALLOWED
define table ztom_t_exceld {
  key mandt    : mandt not null;
  key end_user : syuname not null;
  key vbeln    : vbeln_vf not null;
  new_fkdat    : abap.char(10);
  prev_fkdat   : abap.char(10);
  type         : bapi_mtype;
  message      : bapi_msg;
  "%admin"     : include sych_bdl_draft_admin_inc;

}

 

Create Interface View

Now, let's create Interface views on top of the tables we just created.

Parent Interface View ‚Äì ZCDS_TOM_I_USER
@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED
@EndUserText.label: 'Interface View - Excel User'
@Metadata.allowExtensions: true

define root view entity ZCDS_TOM_I_USER
  as select from    usr02       as _user
    left outer join ztom_t_user as _XLUser on _user.bname = _XLUser.end_user
  composition [0..*] of ZCDS_TOM_I_EXCEL as _XLData
{
  key _user.bname                   as end_user,
      _XLUser.status                as status,
      _XLUser.attachment            as Attachment,
      @Semantics.mimeType: true
      _XLUser.mimetype              as MimeType,
      _XLUser.filename              as Filename,
      @Semantics.user.createdBy: true
      _XLUser.local_created_by      as Local_Created_By,
      @Semantics.systemDateTime.createdAt: true
      _XLUser.local_created_at      as Local_Created_At,
      @Semantics.user.lastChangedBy: true
      _XLUser.local_last_changed_by as Local_Last_Changed_By,
      //local ETag field --> OData ETag
      @Semantics.systemDateTime.localInstanceLastChangedAt: true
      _XLUser.local_last_changed_at as Local_Last_Changed_At,
      //total ETag field
      @Semantics.systemDateTime.lastChangedAt: true
      _XLUser.last_changed_at       as Last_Changed_At,

      _XLData
}
where
  _user.bname = $session.user

 

Child Entity Interface View ‚Äì ZCDS_TOM_I_EXCEL
@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED
@EndUserText.label: 'Interface View - Excel Data'
@Metadata.allowExtensions: true

define view entity ZCDS_TOM_I_EXCEL
  as select from ztom_t_excel
  association to parent ZCDS_TOM_I_USER as _XLUser on $projection.end_user = _XLUser.end_user
{
  key end_user                as end_user,
  key ztom_t_excel.vbeln      as Vbeln,
      ztom_t_excel.new_fkdat  as New_Fkdat,
      ztom_t_excel.prev_fkdat as Prev_Fkdat,
      ztom_t_excel.type       as Type,
      ztom_t_excel.message    as Message,

      _XLUser
}

 

Create Projection/ Consumption View

Now, let's create Projection/ Consumption views on top of the Interfaces we just created.

Parent Projection/ Consumption View ‚Äì ZCDS_TOM_C_USER
@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED
@EndUserText.label: 'Projection Entity - Excel User'
@Metadata.allowExtensions: true

define root view entity ZCDS_TOM_C_USER
  provider contract transactional_query
  as projection on ZCDS_TOM_I_USER
{
  key end_user,
      @EndUserText.label: 'Processing Status'
      status as status,
      @Semantics.largeObject: {
          mimeType: 'MimeType',
          fileName: 'Filename',
          acceptableMimeTypes: [ 'application/vnd.ms-excel','application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.spreadsheetml.sheet' ],
          contentDispositionPreference: #INLINE } // This will store the File into our table
      Attachment,
      MimeType,
      Filename,
      Local_Created_By,
      Local_Created_At,
      Local_Last_Changed_By,
      @EndUserText.label: 'Last Changed At'
      Local_Last_Changed_At,
      Last_Changed_At,

      /* Associations */
      _XLData : redirected to composition child ZCDS_TOM_C_EXCEL
}

 

Child Entity Projection/ Consumption View ‚Äì ZCDS_TOM_C_EXCEL
@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED
@EndUserText.label: 'Projection Entity - Excel Data'
@Metadata.allowExtensions: true

define view entity ZCDS_TOM_C_EXCEL
  as projection on ZCDS_TOM_I_EXCEL
{
  key end_user,
  key Vbeln,
      New_Fkdat,
      Prev_Fkdat,
      Type,
      Message,
      /* Associations */
      _XLUser : redirected to parent ZCDS_TOM_C_USER
}

 

Create Metadata Extensions

Now, let's create Metadata Extensions on top of the Projection/ Consumption views we just created.

Parent Metadata Extension ‚Äì ZCDS_TOM_C_USER
@Metadata.layer: #CORE
@UI.headerInfo: {
    typeName: 'Mass Upload for Billing Date Change',
    typeNamePlural: 'Mass Upload for Billing Date Change'
}

Create Behavior Definitions Behavior Implementation and Behavior Projection

Now, let's create Behavior Definitions on top of the Parent Interface View and Behavior Projection on Parent Projection/ Consumption View we just created.

Behavior Definition ‚Äì ZCDS_TOM_I_USER
managed implementation in class zbp_cl_cds_tom_i_user unique;
strict ( 2 );
with draft;

define behavior for ZCDS_TOM_I_USER alias XLHead
persistent table ztom_t_user
lock master
total etag end_user
draft table ztom_t_userd
//early numbering
authorization master ( instance )
etag master end_user
{
  create;
  update;
  delete;

  field ( readonly ) end_user;

  action ( features : instance ) downloadTemplate result [1] $self;
  action ( features : instance ) downloadData result [1] $self; //Needed in oDataV2 to download excel Data, for oDataV4 comment this

  // Logic to read excel data into into internal table and save to the child entity
  action ( features : instance ) uploadExcelData result [1] $self;

  association _XLData { create; with draft; }

  // Logic to trigger action uploadExcelData
  determination fields on modify { field Filename; }

  //Draft actions
  draft action Edit;
  draft action Activate;
  draft action Discard;
  draft action Resume;
  draft determine action Prepare;

}

define behavior for ZCDS_TOM_I_EXCEL alias XLData
persistent table ztom_t_excel
draft table ztom_t_exceld
lock dependent by _XLUser
authorization dependent by _XLUser
etag master New_Fkdat
{
  update;
  delete;
  field ( readonly ) end_user;

  association _XLUser { with draft; }

  //  action displayDocument result [1] $self; //IF WANT TO ADD A NEW ACTION

}

CLASS lhc_XLHead DEFINITION INHERITING FROM cl_abap_behavior_handler.
  PRIVATE SECTION.

    METHODS get_instance_authorizations FOR INSTANCE AUTHORIZATION
      IMPORTING keys REQUEST requested_authorizations FOR XLHead RESULT result.

    METHODS downloadTemplate FOR MODIFY
      IMPORTING keys FOR ACTION XLHead~downloadTemplate RESULT result.

    METHODS fields FOR DETERMINE ON MODIFY
      IMPORTING keys FOR XLHead~Fields.

    METHODS uploadExcelData FOR MODIFY
      IMPORTING keys FOR ACTION XLHead~uploadExcelData RESULT result.

    "Needed in oDataV2 to download excel Data, for oDataV4 comment this method
    METHODS downloadData FOR MODIFY
      IMPORTING keys FOR ACTION XLHead~downloadData RESULT result.

*    METHODS earlynumbering_create FOR NUMBERING
*      IMPORTING entities FOR CREATE XLHead.

    METHODS get_instance_features FOR INSTANCE FEATURES
      IMPORTING keys REQUEST requested_features FOR XLHead RESULT result.

ENDCLASS.


CLASS lhc_XLHead IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD get_instance_authorizations.
  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD downloadTemplate.
*-- Local Variable Declaration
    DATA: lv_content   TYPE xstring,
          lv_mime_type TYPE string.

*-- Local Internal Table Declaration
    DATA: lt_bin TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF solix.

    "Clear all local objects
    CLEAR: lv_content, lv_mime_type, lt_bin.

*-- Retrieve File From MIME Repository
*-- accessing the file path '/SAP/PUBLIC/ZTOM_MASS_BILLING_DATE_UPD/Billing Date Update Template.xlsx'
    cl_mime_repository_api=>if_mr_api~get_api( )->get( EXPORTING  i_url              = TEXT-001
                                                                  i_check_authority  = abap_false
                                                       IMPORTING  e_content          = lv_content
                                                                  e_mime_type        = lv_mime_type
                                                       EXCEPTIONS parameter_missing  = 1
                                                                  error_occured      = 2
                                                                  not_found          = 3
                                                                  permission_failure = 4
                                                                  OTHERS             = 5 ).

    IF sy-subrc <> 0.
      "Handle Error Messages
      INSERT new_message( id       = sy-msgid
                          number   = sy-msgno
                          severity = if_abap_behv_message=>severity-error
                          v1       = sy-msgv1
                          v2       = sy-msgv2
                          v3       = sy-msgv3
                          v4       = sy-msgv4 )
             INTO TABLE reported-%other.
    ELSE.
      "Modify Root Entity
      MODIFY ENTITIES OF zcds_tom_i_user IN LOCAL MODE
      ENTITY XLHead
      UPDATE FROM VALUE #( FOR key IN keys
                           ( end_user            = key-end_user
                             status              = TEXT-002 "Template Downloaded
                             Attachment          = lv_content
                             Filename            = TEXT-003 "Billing Date Update Template
                             MimeType            = lv_mime_type
                             %control-status     = if_abap_behv=>mk-on
                             %control-Attachment = if_abap_behv=>mk-on
                             %control-Filename   = if_abap_behv=>mk-on
                             %control-MimeType   = if_abap_behv=>mk-on ) )
      MAPPED DATA(ls_mapped_update)
      REPORTED DATA(ls_reported_update)
      FAILED DATA(ls_failed_update).

      "Read Updated Entry
      READ ENTITIES OF zcds_tom_i_user IN LOCAL MODE
      ENTITY XLHead
      ALL FIELDS WITH
      CORRESPONDING #( Keys )
      RESULT DATA(lt_XLHead).

      "Send Status back to front end
      result = VALUE #( FOR lwa_upd_head IN lt_XLHead
                        ( %tky   = lwa_upd_head-%tky
                          %param = lwa_upd_head ) ).
    ENDIF.
  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD fields.
    SELECT  INTO (lv_valid) FROM ztom_t_user UP TO 1 ROWS WHERE end_user = -uname.
    ENDSELECT.

    IF lv_valid <> abap_true.
      INSERT ztom_t_user FROM @( VALUE #( end_user = sy-uname ) ).
    ENDIF.

    IF keys[ 1 ]-%is_draft = '01'. "for oDataV4 '01' needs to be replaced with '00'
      MODIFY ENTITIES OF zcds_tom_i_user IN LOCAL MODE
      ENTITY XLHead
      EXECUTE uploadexceldata
      FROM CORRESPONDING #( keys ).
    ENDIF.
  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD uploadExcelData.
*-- Local Variable Declaration
    DATA: lv_index    TYPE sy-index.

*-- Local Workarea Declaration
    DATA: ls_vbrk_i TYPE vbrk.

*-- Local Internal Table Declaration
    DATA: lt_excel TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zbp_cl_cds_tom_i_user=>gty_input,
          lt_data  TYPE TABLE FOR CREATE zcds_tom_i_user\_XLData.

*-- Local Object Declaration
    DATA: lo_table_descr  TYPE REF TO cl_abap_tabledescr,
          lo_struct_descr TYPE REF TO cl_abap_structdescr.

*-- Local Field Symbol Declaration
    FIELD-SYMBOLS:  <lfs_col_header> TYPE any.

    "Clear all local objects
    CLEAR: lv_index, lt_excel, lt_data.

    SELECT  INTO (lv_valid) FROM ztom_t_user UP TO 1 ROWS WHERE end_user = -uname.
    ENDSELECT.

    IF lv_valid <> abap_true.
      INSERT ztom_t_user FROM @( VALUE #( end_user = sy-uname ) ).
    ENDIF.

    DATA(lv_user) = cl_abap_context_info=>get_user_technical_name( ).

    READ ENTITIES OF zcds_tom_i_user IN LOCAL MODE
    ENTITY XLHead
    ALL FIELDS WITH
    CORRESPONDING #( keys )
    RESULT DATA(lt_file_entity).

    DATA(lv_attachment) = lt_file_entity[ 1 ]-attachment.

    IF lv_attachment IS INITIAL.
      RETURN.
    ENDIF.

    "Move Excel Data to Internal Table
    DATA(lo_xlsx) = xco_cp_xlsx=>document->for_file_content( iv_file_content = lv_attachment )->read_access( ).
    DATA(lo_worksheet) = lo_xlsx->get_workbook( )->worksheet->at_position( 1 ).
    DATA(lo_selection_pattern) = xco_cp_xlsx_selection=>pattern_builder->simple_from_to( )->get_pattern( ).
    DATA(lo_execute) = lo_worksheet->select( lo_selection_pattern )->row_stream( )->operation->write_to(
                                                                      REF #( lt_excel ) ).
    lo_execute->set_value_transformation( xco_cp_xlsx_read_access=>value_transformation->string_value )->if_xco_xlsx_ra_operation~execute( ).

    "Get number of columns in upload file for validation
    TRY.
        lo_table_descr ?= cl_abap_tabledescr=>describe_by_data( p_data = lt_excel ).
        lo_struct_descr ?= lo_table_descr->get_table_line_type( ).
        DATA(lv_no_of_cols) = lines( lo_struct_descr->components ).
      CATCH cx_sy_move_cast_error INTO DATA(lo_sy_move_cast_error).

        "Implement error handling
        INSERT new_message( id       = sy-msgid
                            number   = sy-msgno
                            severity = if_abap_behv_message=>severity-error
                            v1       = sy-msgv1
                            v2       = sy-msgv2
                            v3       = sy-msgv3
                            v4       = sy-msgv4 )
               INTO TABLE reported-%other.
    ENDTRY.

*-- Remove Headings of Columns from Excel data
    IF lt_excel IS NOT INITIAL.
      DELETE lt_excel INDEX 1.
    ENDIF.

*-- Remove all entries where Billing document is not available
    IF lt_excel IS NOT INITIAL.
      DELETE lt_excel WHERE vbeln IS INITIAL.
    ENDIF.

*-- Remove all duplicates
    IF lt_excel IS NOT INITIAL.
      DELETE ADJACENT DUPLICATES FROM lt_excel.
    ENDIF.

    IF lt_excel IS NOT INITIAL.
      LOOP AT lt_excel ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<lfs_excel>).
        DO lv_no_of_cols TIMES.
          lv_index = sy-index.
          ASSIGN COMPONENT lv_index OF STRUCTURE <lfs_excel> TO <lfs_col_header>.
          IF <lfs_col_header> IS NOT ASSIGNED.
            CONTINUE.
          ENDIF.
          DATA(lv_has_error) = abap_false.
          CASE lv_index.
            WHEN 1. "Billing Document Number
              CALL FUNCTION 'CONVERSION_EXIT_ALPHA_INPUT'
                EXPORTING
                  input  = <lfs_col_header>
                IMPORTING
                  output = <lfs_col_header>.

              SELECT SINGLE fkdat
                FROM vbrk
                INTO (lv_fkdat)
                WHERE vbeln = @<lfs_col_header>.

              IF sy-subrc = 0.
                <lfs_excel>-prev_fkdat = |{ lv_fkdat+6(2) }.{ lv_fkdat+4(2) }.{ lv_fkdat(4) }|.
                CLEAR: lv_fkdat.
              ENDIF.

            WHEN 2.  "New Billing Date
              FIND PCRE '(\d{1,2}[.]\d{1,2}[.]\d{4})' IN <lfs_col_header>.
              IF sy-subrc = 0.
                CALL FUNCTION '/SAPDMC/LSM_DATE_CONVERT'
                  EXPORTING
                    date_in             = <lfs_col_header>
                    date_format_in      = 'DDMY'
                    to_output_format    = ' '
                    to_internal_format  = 'X'
                  IMPORTING
                    date_out            = <lfs_col_header>
                  EXCEPTIONS
                    illegal_date        = 1
                    illegal_date_format = 2
                    no_user_date_format = 3
                    OTHERS              = 4.
                IF sy-subrc <> 0.
                  <lfs_excel>-type    = 'E'.
                  <lfs_excel>-message = TEXT-004.   "Invalid Date
                ELSE.
                  IF <lfs_col_header>+0(2) EQ '00'.
                    <lfs_excel>-type    = 'E'.
                    <lfs_excel>-message = TEXT-004.   "Invalid Date
                  ELSE.
                    lv_fkdat = <lfs_col_header>.
                  ENDIF.
                ENDIF.
              ELSE.
                <lfs_excel>-type    = 'E'.
                <lfs_excel>-message = TEXT-004.   "Invalid Date
              ENDIF.
            WHEN 3 OR 4 OR 5.
              "Do Nothing!!
*              lv_has_error = COND #( WHEN <lfs_col_header> <> ' ' THEN abap_true ELSE lv_has_error ).
            WHEN OTHERS. "More than 5 columns (error)
              lv_has_error = abap_true.
          ENDCASE.
          UNASSIGN <lfs_col_header>.
        ENDDO.
        IF lv_has_error = abap_true.
          APPEND VALUE #( %tky = lt_file_entity[ 1 ]-%tky ) TO failed-xlhead.
          APPEND VALUE #( %tky = lt_file_entity[ 1 ]-%tky
                          %msg = new_message_with_text( severity = if_abap_behv_message=>severity-error
                                                        text     = TEXT-005 ) ) "Wrong File Format!!
          TO reported-xlhead.
          UNASSIGN <lfs_col_header>.
          EXIT.
        ELSE. "Process Data
          "Update Billing Date
          IF <lfs_excel>-type <> 'E'.
            TRY.
                zcl_tom_billing_date_upd=>zfm_tom_billing_date_upd( EXPORTING fkdat   = lv_fkdat
                                                                              vbeln   = <lfs_excel>-vbeln
*                                                                              _dest_  = 'NONE'
                                                                    CHANGING  message = <lfs_excel>-message
                                                                              mtype   = <lfs_excel>-type ).
              CATCH cx_aco_application_exception INTO DATA(lo_aco_application_exception).
              CATCH cx_aco_communication_failure INTO DATA(lo_aco_communication_failure).
              CATCH cx_aco_system_failure INTO DATA(lo_aco_system_failure).

                "Implement error handling
                INSERT new_message( id       = sy-msgid
                                    number   = sy-msgno
                                    severity = if_abap_behv_message=>severity-error
                                    v1       = sy-msgv1
                                    v2       = sy-msgv2
                                    v3       = sy-msgv3
                                    v4       = sy-msgv4 )
                       INTO TABLE reported-%other.
            ENDTRY.

            "Change Format to DD.MM.YYYY
            <lfs_excel>-new_fkdat = |{ <lfs_excel>-new_fkdat+6(2) }.{ <lfs_excel>-new_fkdat+4(2) }.{ <lfs_excel>-new_fkdat(4) }|.

          ENDIF.
        ENDIF.
      ENDLOOP.

    ELSE.
      APPEND VALUE #( %tky = lt_file_entity[ 1 ]-%tky ) TO failed-xlhead.
      APPEND VALUE #( %tky = lt_file_entity[ 1 ]-%tky
                      %msg = new_message_with_text( severity = if_abap_behv_message=>severity-error
                                                    text     = TEXT-006 ) ) "No Input Data to Process in Excel!!
      TO reported-xlhead.
      EXIT.
    ENDIF.

*-- Sort with Error & Success type
    IF lt_excel IS NOT INITIAL.
      SORT: lt_excel ASCENDING BY type vbeln.
    ENDIF.

    "Prepare Data for Child Entity (XLData)
    lt_data = VALUE #( ( %cid_ref  = keys[ 1 ]-%cid_ref
                         %is_draft = keys[ 1 ]-%is_draft
                         end_user  = keys[ 1 ]-end_user
                         %target   = VALUE #( FOR lwa_excel IN lt_excel
                                              ( %cid      = keys[ 1 ]-%cid_ref
                                                %is_draft = keys[ 1 ]-%is_draft
                                                %data     = VALUE #( end_user   = keys[ 1 ]-end_user
                                                                     Vbeln      = lwa_excel-vbeln
                                                                     New_Fkdat  = lwa_excel-new_fkdat
                                                                     Prev_Fkdat = lwa_excel-prev_fkdat
                                                                     Type       = lwa_excel-type
                                                                     Message    = lwa_excel-message )
                                                %control  = VALUE #( end_user   = if_abap_behv=>mk-on
                                                                     Vbeln      = if_abap_behv=>mk-on
                                                                     New_Fkdat  = if_abap_behv=>mk-on
                                                                     Prev_Fkdat = if_abap_behv=>mk-on
                                                                     Type       = if_abap_behv=>mk-on
                                                                     Message    = if_abap_behv=>mk-on ) ) ) ) ).

    "Checking Existing entry in child entity for user if any
    READ ENTITIES OF zcds_tom_i_user IN LOCAL MODE
    ENTITY XLHead
    BY \_XLData
    ALL FIELDS WITH CORRESPONDING #( keys )
    RESULT DATA(lt_existing_XLData).

    IF lt_existing_XLData IS NOT INITIAL.
      "Delete already existing entries from child entity
      MODIFY ENTITIES OF zcds_tom_i_user IN LOCAL MODE
      ENTITY XLData DELETE FROM VALUE #( FOR lwa_data IN lt_existing_XLData
                                         ( %key      = lwa_data-%key
                                           %is_draft = lwa_data-%is_draft ) )
      MAPPED DATA(ls_del_mapped)
      REPORTED DATA(ls_del_reported)
      FAILED DATA(ls_del_failed).
    ENDIF.

    "Modify Root View data (Change Status)
    MODIFY ENTITIES OF zcds_tom_i_user IN LOCAL MODE
    ENTITY XLHead
    UPDATE FROM VALUE #( FOR key IN keys
                         ( %is_draft       = key-%is_draft
                           end_user        = key-end_user
                           status          = TEXT-007 "File Processed
                           %control-status = if_abap_behv=>mk-on ) )
    MAPPED DATA(ls_mapped_update)
    REPORTED DATA(ls_reported_update)
    FAILED DATA(ls_failed_update).

    "Add New Entry for XLData (association)
    MODIFY ENTITIES OF zcds_tom_i_user IN LOCAL MODE
    ENTITY XLHead
    CREATE BY \_XLData
    AUTO FILL CID
    WITH lt_data.

    "Read Updated Entry
    READ ENTITIES OF zcds_tom_i_user IN LOCAL MODE
    ENTITY XLHead
    ALL FIELDS WITH
    CORRESPONDING #( Keys )
    RESULT DATA(lt_updated_XLHead).

    "Send Status back to front end
    result = VALUE #( FOR lwa_upd_head IN lt_updated_XLHead
                      ( %tky   = lwa_upd_head-%tky
                        %param = lwa_upd_head ) ).
  ENDMETHOD.

  "Needed in oDataV2 to download excel Data, for oDataV4 comment this method
  METHOD downloadData.
*-- Local Variable Declaration
    DATA: lo_columns TYPE REF TO cl_salv_columns_table.
    DATA: lo_column TYPE REF TO cl_salv_column.

    "Fetch Processed Data
    SELECT * FROM ztom_t_excel
    INTO TABLE (lt_final)
    WHERE end_user = -uname.

    IF lt_final IS NOT INITIAL.
      "Get Time Stamp
      GET TIME STAMP FIELD DATA(lv_timestampl).

      "Convert Internal table data to xstring.
      DATA(lv_filename) = |{ TEXT-008 } { lv_timestampl }|. "Billing Date Update Log

      "Convert internal table data to excel and download.
      TRY.
          cl_salv_table=>factory( IMPORTING r_salv_table = DATA(lo_table)
                                  CHANGING  t_table      = lt_final ).

          "Get ALV Column
          lo_columns = lo_table->get_columns( ).

          TRY.
              lo_column = lo_columns->get_column( 'NEW_FKDAT' ).
              lo_column->set_long_text( TEXT-009 ). "New Billing Date
              lo_column->set_output_length( '15' ).
            CATCH cx_salv_not_found INTO DATA(lo_salv_not_found).

              "Implement error handling
              INSERT new_message( id       = sy-msgid
                                  number   = sy-msgno
                                  severity = if_abap_behv_message=>severity-error
                                  v1       = sy-msgv1
                                  v2       = sy-msgv2
                                  v3       = sy-msgv3
                                  v4       = sy-msgv4 )
                     INTO TABLE reported-%other.
          ENDTRY.

          TRY.
              lo_column = lo_columns->get_column( 'PREV_FKDAT' ).
              lo_column->set_long_text( TEXT-010 ).  "Previous Billing Date
              lo_column->set_output_length( '15' ).
            CATCH cx_salv_not_found INTO lo_salv_not_found.

              "Implement error handling
              INSERT new_message( id       = sy-msgid
                                  number   = sy-msgno
                                  severity = if_abap_behv_message=>severity-error
                                  v1       = sy-msgv1
                                  v2       = sy-msgv2
                                  v3       = sy-msgv3
                                  v4       = sy-msgv4 )
                     INTO TABLE reported-%other.
          ENDTRY.

          DATA(lv_content) = lo_table->to_xml( xml_type = if_salv_bs_xml=>c_type_xlsx ).

        CATCH cx_salv_msg INTO DATA(lo_salv_msg).

          "Implement error handling
          INSERT new_message( id       = sy-msgid
                              number   = sy-msgno
                              severity = if_abap_behv_message=>severity-error
                              v1       = sy-msgv1
                              v2       = sy-msgv2
                              v3       = sy-msgv3
                              v4       = sy-msgv4 )
                 INTO TABLE reported-%other.
      ENDTRY.

      "Modify Root Entity
      MODIFY ENTITIES OF zcds_tom_i_user IN LOCAL MODE
      ENTITY XLHead
      UPDATE FROM VALUE #( FOR key IN keys
                           ( end_user            = key-end_user
                             status              = TEXT-011 "Data Downloaded
                             Attachment          = lv_content
                             Filename            = lv_filename
                             MimeType            = TEXT-012   "application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.spreadsheetml.sheet
                             %control-status     = if_abap_behv=>mk-on
                             %control-Attachment = if_abap_behv=>mk-on
                             %control-Filename   = if_abap_behv=>mk-on
                             %control-MimeType   = if_abap_behv=>mk-on ) )
      MAPPED DATA(ls_mapped_update)
      REPORTED DATA(ls_reported_update)
      FAILED DATA(ls_failed_update).

      "Read Updated Entry
      READ ENTITIES OF zcds_tom_i_user IN LOCAL MODE
      ENTITY XLHead
      ALL FIELDS WITH
      CORRESPONDING #( Keys )
      RESULT DATA(lt_XLHead).

      "Send Status back to front end
      result = VALUE #( FOR lwa_upd_head IN lt_XLHead
                        ( %tky   = lwa_upd_head-%tky
                          %param = lwa_upd_head ) ).
    ENDIF.
  ENDMETHOD.

*  METHOD earlynumbering_create.
*  DATA(lv_user) = cl_abap_context_info=>get_user_technical_name( ).
*    LOOP AT entities ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<lfs_entities>).
*      APPEND CORRESPONDING #( <lfs_entities> ) TO mapped-xlhead
*          ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<lfs_xlhead>).
*      <lfs_xlhead>-end_user = lv_user.
*    ENDLOOP.
*  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD get_instance_features.
    READ ENTITIES OF zcds_tom_i_user IN LOCAL MODE
    ENTITY XLHead
    FIELDS ( end_user )
    WITH CORRESPONDING #( keys )
    RESULT DATA(lt_file).

    result = VALUE #( FOR ls_file IN lt_file
                      ( %key                              = ls_file-%key
                        %is_draft                         = ls_file-%is_draft
                        %features-%action-uploadexceldata = COND #( WHEN ls_file-%is_draft = '00'
                                                                    THEN if_abap_behv=>fc-f-read_only
                                                                    ELSE if_abap_behv=>fc-f-unrestricted ) ) ).
  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.


*CLASS lhc_XLData DEFINITION INHERITING FROM cl_abap_behavior_handler.
*
*  PRIVATE SECTION.
*    METHODS get_instance_authorizations FOR INSTANCE AUTHORIZATION
*      IMPORTING keys REQUEST requested_authorizations FOR XLData RESULT result.
*
*    METHODS displayDocument FOR MODIFY
*      IMPORTING keys FOR ACTION XLData~displayDocument RESULT result.
*
*ENDCLASS.
*
*
*CLASS lhc_XLData IMPLEMENTATION.
*  METHOD get_instance_authorizations.
*  ENDMETHOD.
*
*  METHOD displayDocument.
*    "Read Child Entity
*    READ ENTITIES OF zcds_tom_i_user IN LOCAL MODE
*        ENTITY XLData
*        ALL FIELDS WITH
*        CORRESPONDING #( keys )
*        RESULT FINAL(lt_data).
*
*    IF lt_data IS NOT INITIAL.
*      "Convert Internal table data for excel
*
*      "Read Updated Entry
*      READ ENTITIES OF zcds_tom_i_user IN LOCAL MODE
*      ENTITY XLData
*      ALL FIELDS WITH
*      CORRESPONDING #( Keys )
*      RESULT DATA(lt_XLData).
*
*      "Send Status back to front end
*      result = VALUE #( FOR lwa_upd_data IN lt_XLData
*                        ( %tky   = lwa_upd_data-%tky
*                          %param = lwa_upd_data ) ).
*    ENDIF.
*  ENDMETHOD.
*ENDCLASS.‚Äã
  • Function Module used in RAP to update Billing Date -
    we have created a remote enabled custom FM ZFM_TOM_BILLING_DATE_UPD as we don't have released SAP APIs available in our system. Then we have rapped it by transaction ACO_PROXY and created a proxy class ZCL_TOM_BILLING_DATE_UPD.
    This proxy class will be called in behavior Implementation class to update billing date.
    Click on Hyperlink to check full blog How to generate a wrapper for function modules (BAPIs) for missing released SAP APIs 

    Function module logic is mentioned below:
FUNCTION zfm_tom_billing_date_upd
  IMPORTING
    VALUE(vbeln) TYPE vbeln_vf
    VALUE(fkdat) TYPE fkdat
  CHANGING
    VALUE(mtype) TYPE bapi_mtype OPTIONAL
    VALUE(message) TYPE bapi_msg OPTIONAL
  EXCEPTIONS
    no_authority.



  DATA: ls_vbrk_i TYPE vbrk,
        ls_vbrk_e TYPE vbrk,
        ls_vbsk   TYPE vbsk.

  DATA: lt_xkomv  TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF komv,
        lt_xvbpa  TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF vbpavb,
        lt_xvbrk  TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF vbrkvb,
        lt_xvbrp  TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF vbrpvb,
        lt_xkomfk TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF komfk,
        lt_xvbfs  TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF vbfs,
        lt_xthead TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF theadvb,
        lt_xvbss  TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF vbss.

  CLEAR: ls_vbrk_i,
  ls_vbrk_e,
  ls_vbsk.

  REFRESH: lt_xkomv,
  lt_xvbpa,
  lt_xvbrk,
  lt_xvbrp,
  lt_xkomfk,
  lt_xvbfs,
  lt_xthead,
  lt_xvbss.

  ls_vbrk_i-vbeln = vbeln.

  TRY.
      "Read billing doc
      CALL FUNCTION 'RV_INVOICE_DOCUMENT_READ'
        EXPORTING
*         ACTIVITY     = '  '
          konv_read    = 'X'
*         NO_NAST      = ' '
          vbrk_i       = ls_vbrk_i
*         I_NO_AUTHORITY_CHECK = ' '
*         OIA_UNZIP_FEES =
*         I_GV_ERDAT_SEL =
*         IV_NO_PRICING_BUFFER = ABAP_FALSE
        IMPORTING
          vbrk_e       = ls_vbrk_e
*         VBUK_E       =
        TABLES
          xkomv        = lt_xkomv
          xvbpa        = lt_xvbpa
          xvbrk        = lt_xvbrk
          xvbrp        = lt_xvbrp
          xkomfk       = lt_xkomfk
          xvbfs        = lt_xvbfs
          xthead       = lt_xthead
          xvbss        = lt_xvbss
*        CHANGING
*         i_data_read_from_archive =
        EXCEPTIONS
          no_authority = 1
          OTHERS       = 2.
      IF sy-subrc <> 0.
* If BAPI is not successful, Implement error handling
        mtype    = 'E'.
        message = TEXT-001.  "Error in Reading Billing Document

      ELSE.
        "Change Billing Date
        ls_vbrk_e-fkdat = fkdat.   "New Billing date

        "Apply Changes
        CALL FUNCTION 'RV_INVOICE_HEAD_MAINTAIN'
          EXPORTING
*           FCODE_I = '    '
            vbrk_i = ls_vbrk_e
          TABLES
            xkomfk = lt_xkomfk
            xkomv  = lt_xkomv
            xthead = lt_xthead
            xvbfs  = lt_xvbfs
            xvbpa  = lt_xvbpa
            xvbrk  = lt_xvbrk
            xvbrp  = lt_xvbrp
            xvbss  = lt_xvbss.

        IF sy-subrc <> 0.
* If BAPI is not successful, Implement error handling
          mtype    = 'E'.
          message = TEXT-002.    "Error in Applying Changes

        ELSE.
          ls_vbsk-mandt = sy-mandt.
          ls_vbsk-ernam = ls_vbrk_e-ernam.
          ls_vbsk-erdat = ls_vbrk_e-erdat.
          ls_vbsk-uzeit = ls_vbrk_e-erzet.

          "Save the Changes
          CALL FUNCTION 'RV_INVOICE_DOCUMENT_ADD'
            EXPORTING
              vbsk_i = ls_vbsk
*             with_posting = 'X'
*             WITHOUT_REFRESH = ' '
*             PREISFINDUNGSART = 'A'
*             I_NO_VBLOG = ' '
*             I_NO_NAST = ' '
*             I_NO_PRICING = ' '
*             I_NO_FI_DOC = ' '
*             I_BLART = ' '
*             IS_FI_ADD_INPUT =
*             I_NO_COLLECTIVE_BILLING =
*             IV_SNAPSHOT_ACTIVATION = ABAP_FALSE
*             IV_SUPPRESS_GTS_IN_SIM_MODE = ABAP_FALSE
*             IV_NO_TAX_CALC_IN_SIM_MODE = ABAP_FALSE
*             IMPORTING
*             VBSK_E =
            TABLES
              xkomfk = lt_xkomfk
              xkomv  = lt_xkomv
              xthead = lt_xthead
              xvbfs  = lt_xvbfs
              xvbpa  = lt_xvbpa
              xvbrk  = lt_xvbrk
              xvbrp  = lt_xvbrp
              xvbss  = lt_xvbss.

          IF sy-subrc <> 0.
* If BAPI is not successful, Implement error handling
            mtype    = 'E'.
            message = TEXT-003.  "Error in Saving the Changes
          ELSE.
            mtype    = 'S'.
            message = TEXT-004.  "Billing Date Changed Successfully
          ENDIF.
        ENDIF.
      ENDIF.

    CATCH cx_root INTO DATA(lx).

  ENDTRY.

ENDFUNCTION.‚Äã

 

Behavior Projection ‚Äì ZCDS_TOM_C_USER
projection;
strict ( 2 );
use draft;

define behavior for ZCDS_TOM_C_USER //alias XLHead
{
  //  use create;
  use update;
  use delete;

  field ( readonly ) end_user, status, Local_Last_Changed_At;

  use action downloadTemplate;
  use action downloadData; //Needed in oDataV2 to download excel Data, for oDataV4 comment this

  use action Edit;
  use action Activate;
  use action Discard;
  use action Resume;
  use action Prepare;

  use association _XLData { create; with draft; }
}

define behavior for ZCDS_TOM_C_EXCEL //alias XLData
{
  //  use update; //IF WANT USER TO ENABLE EDIT IN EXCEL DATA UNCOMMENT THIS
  //  use delete; //IF WANT USER TO DELETE PROCESSED EXCEL DATA UNCOMMENT THIS

  use association _XLUser { with draft; }

  //  use action displayDocument; //IF WANT TO ADD A NEW ACTION
}

 

Create Service Definition

Now, let's create Service Definitions, exposing both Behavior Definition and Projection we just created.

Service Definition ‚Äì ZCDS_TOM_SD_MASS_FKDAT
@EndUserText.label: 'Service Definition for Projection Views'
define service ZCDS_TOM_SD_MASS_FKDAT {
  expose ZCDS_TOM_C_USER as XLHead;
  expose ZCDS_TOM_C_EXCEL as XLData;
}

 

Create Service Binding

Now, let's create Service Binding (I tested with V2) on top of Service Definition we just created.

If You are using V4 Services, you don't need to create separate action downloadData (comment it out) as we are already having an option to export the data as an excel in V4 Services.

 

See the wonders...üåü

The list report page would look like below for V2 Services, in V4 Services you will see an extra option to export data as an excel- 

Click on Go -

 

Person Responsible will be the Session User, Click anywhere on the line or on arrow - 

 

Click on Download Template button to Load Template, this action can be performed on first screen as well by selection line item and click download template, Template will be loaded successfully as an excel attachment.

 

Click on Hyperlink to download Template.

 

Template can be deleted by clicking on Delete Button, this same delete button will be used to delete processed data entries.

 

Click on Edit button on previous screen and You can now update entries in the template and upload the data.

 

Data will be processed, now click on save.

 

Status will be changed to 'File Processed'.

 

Click on Download Data to load Processed Data as an Excel Attachment.

 

Hope it will be helpful!!

entry.title: BiWhy ‚Äì CMS DB Analysis
entry.content:
Disclaimer:
 
BiWhy was conceived as comprehensive support tool for SAP BusinessObjects (BOBJ) to troubleshoot issues and facilitate administrative tasks, but as about half of its functionality is not directly tied to BOBJ, it can be used to troubleshoot and monitor other products. That makes it a General-Purpose Support Tool, with the goal of including functionality most demanded by support engineers and software administrators.
 
BiWhy is currently available exclusively through CoE Max Attention Engagements.

 

What it is for:
Analyse CMS DB:
  • Understand your system usage.
  • Identify what is causing growth (count or size-wise).
  • See what is retained over time.
  • Analyze time trends.
 
Compare two snapshots to identify differences and common parts:
  • Between target and source systems to verify promotion.
  • For the same system to see what has changed.
 
When to run it:
  • Occasionally, to get an impression of what is happening in the system and for housekeeping purposes.
  • NB: Before migration or major promotions, it is a good idea to clean up the CMS DB to speed up promotion and reduce the number of failures.
 
Background
  • This functionality has already been used with more than 38 customers, in some cases repeatedly and across multiple systems.
  • The largest CMS DB processed contained 34 million objects.
  • CMS DB fetch is optimized with indexed fields, filters, self-tuning batch size, and incremental fetch options.
 
Analysis & Visualization with BiWhy Embedded Analytic Controls
  • Flexible table:
    • Show/hide columns
    • Group/aggregate
    • Regex filters for any column
    • Global and local statistics
    • Export to Excel
  • Set of charts
  • CMS DB tree:
    • Build by folders or parents
    • Choose how to view a node (show/hide any available field)
    • Sort by selected field
    • Search

entry.title: Re: SAP Business Data Cloud Series ‚Äì Part 1: Introduction to Data Products
entry.content:
@tsvetomir_mlade :

The FOS layer (HDLF ‚Äì HANA Data Lake Files / Object Store) enables customers to adopt a data lake house architecture. Its main benefit is cost-effective, high-volume storage, making it well-suited for scenarios such as advanced analytics, AI/ML, and long-term historical reporting. For example, AI/ML models often require 5‚Äì10 years of data for better outcomes, which can be stored more economically in FOS. Please read top 5 Q&A.

However, there is a trade-off between performance and cost:

  • HANA Cloud DB (Datasphere) provides the best performance (disk + in-memory) but comes with higher infrastructure cost.

  • FOS (HDLF / BDC-FOS) offers low-cost persistence but requires data to be read from files into memory, which impacts performance.

That‚Äôs why in practice, the recommendation is usually a hybrid approach, combining different storage and access methods depending on the use case:

  1. HDLF (BDC-FOS / Data Lakehouse) ‚Äì Best for AI/ML, historical, or archived reporting where large volumes of data are needed but not always in real-time.

  2. HANA Cloud DB (Datasphere) ‚Äì Best for frequently accessed data where high performance is critical.
  3. Data Federation / Remote Access (CDS Views from S/4) ‚Äì Best for real-time operational analytics without data replication.

Example scenario ‚Äì Sales Data (2021‚Äì2025):

  • HDLF (BDC-FOS) ‚Äì Store older years (e.g., 2021‚Äì2023) for cost-effective long-term analysis.

  • HANA Cloud DB (Datasphere) ‚Äì Keep the most recent year (e.g., 2024) for high-performance analytics.
  • Remote Access (CDS Views) ‚Äì Use live, current-year data (e.g., 2025) for real-time reporting.

A reporting model can then union across these layers, with performance depending on the storage source.

In short, data products are not just about persistence‚Äîthey enable customers to balance cost, performance, and business requirements by combining multiple technologies (FOS + HANA Cloud DB + Federation).

Hope this clarifies ‚Äì Jeet

entry.title: Extend nested standard CDS-Views
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I would like to dive deeper into the topic of view extensions of standard CDS views. I am familiar with the basic concept and the implementation, and everything is understandable for simple or flat CDS views.

However, there are hardly any standard CDS views that have only one level, but rather multiple ones. The question that arises for me is whether it is always necessary to extend all levels in order to access a field on the "top" level. Or what is the best practice in this case (for example: extend all views? Build a custom view on the interface view and join / associate the desired table/view again? etc.) 

For the sake of comprehension, here a concrete example:

The table VBAK was extended by a custom field, via append. I now want to include the respective field in the CDS view I_SalesOrder. The view I_SalesOrder has three hierarchy levels: I_SalesOrder -> I_SalesDocument -> I_SalesDocumentBasic. The latter selects the table VBAK.

Is it now the correct way to extend all three CDS views in order to be able to access the field in I_SalesOrder? 

Thanks in advance for the help.

Best regards,
Lukas
